benchmark_details.name: Speak-to-Structure (S2-Bench)
benchmark_details.overview: S2-Bench is the first benchmark designed to evaluate the open-domain natural language-driven molecule generation capabilities of LLMs, structured around tasks that reflect real-world molecular design challenges.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for evaluating LLMs on their ability to create diverse molecular candidates from natural language descriptions.

data.source: S2-Bench is constructed programmatically using large chemical databases like PubChem and Zinc-250K.
data.size: 45,000 test samples for S2-Bench, with OpenMolIns providing up to 1,200,000 instruction-molecule pairs.
data.annotation: Automated evaluation based on objective molecular properties and structural rules.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the model's adherence to task requirements and the quality of generated molecules.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with desired molecular properties and structural integrity.
methodology.baseline_results: The benchmark evaluates multiple LLMs, with performance comparisons documented in detailed tables.
methodology.validation: S2-Bench's design ensures diverse and robust evaluation of LLM capabilities in molecule generation.
